page.title: 10The Village Shop
page.content: During the summer of this year Sulgrave Stores has changed hands and is now owned by a local family who also own the garage in the village.The shop provides a vital service as it is the only shop in the area.Old people appreciate being able to buy vegetables bread and groceries without travelling 7 miles to the nearest town. Many of the goods sold have to be collected by the owner from a large Cash and Carry warehouse in Northampton but fresh goods are delivered regularly by wholesalers.Bread is brought from a nearby village bakery and is sometimes still warm when it arrives.Various shapes of loaves are sold,bloomer,batch tin and cottage.A large loaf costs 51p. Other deliveries include fruit,sweets, vegetables,dairy produce and biscuits. A petrol pump in the yard sells petrol for just over $2 per gallon.
